conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway/isometric-style render: walls extruded with thickness, multiple faces visible, and interior volumes readable from an elevated angle with the ceiling/roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; clean cutaway. Minor simplification in some edge/corner detailing and small-space geometry.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match the 2D plan (living/dining central, kitchen bottom/center, bedrooms around perimeter, decks at top/top-right). Minor proportion/partition deviations in service/toilet corridor areas and some opening placements/sizes appear simplified.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present and placed plausibly (beds in bedrooms, sofa/living set, dining table, kitchen counters, bathrooms with fixtures). Some secondary elements are simplified or omitted.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with consistent materials and good visibility; minor softness/blur and simplified window/door detailing reduce structural clarity slightly. Background is clean and no UI/text contamination.

detected_errors.description: Doors/windows/openings are present but some placements and proportions appear simplified compared to the 2D plan (not all swings/frames match exactly).
Small-room/service-core partitioning (toilet/utility/corridor zones) shows minor proportional/layout drift from the 2D plan, though overall adjacency remains consistent.

summary: A genuine 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity and furnishing, with only minor-to-moderate inaccuracies in smaller partitions and opening details.
